edu.berkeley.compbio.ml.mcmc

Interface DataCollector

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TextFileDataCollector

    public interface DataCollector
    Interface for objects that can collect timecourse samples from a Monte Carlo simulation. The collected timecourses are essentially arrays, whose indexes should all correspond; there is no explicit sense of the time scale except for the array index. Of course it is possible to add a timecourse which records the time (or step number, etc.) at which each sample is taken.

    In addition to the timecourses (which typically record some summary statistics about the chain state), the DataCollector allows storing String representations of the complete state itself.

    Finally, DataCollectors may have hierarchical structure; for instance, a DataCollector for a metropolis-coupled monte carlo simulation can contiain a child DataCollector for each chain.

    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    David Soergel

    • Method Detail

      • close

        void close()
        Perform any summary computations and clean up resources, e.g. closing output streams and database connections.

      • init

        void init()
        Initialize this DataCollector. May be automatically called by Spring, even if there are no explicit references to it in the code.

      • newSubCollector

        DataCollector newSubCollector(String name)
        Create and return a DataCollector that is a child of this one.
        Parameters:
        name - a String describing the child DataCollector that distinguishes it from other children
        Returns:
        the newly created DataCollector

      • setTimecourseValue

        void setTimecourseValue(String name,
                      double val)
        Append the given value to the named timecourse. Note it's important to keep all timecourses in sync by calling this once for each timecourse when a sample is recorded.
        Parameters:
        name - the String name of the timecourse
        val - the double value to append

      • writeSample

        void writeSample(String s)
        Record a String, which should represent the complete state of the chain. Should be used exclusively by implementations of MonteCarloState.writeToDataCollector().
        Parameters:
        s - the String to record
